title: Sources
text: The dataset used in this project is the ‘Income Dataset’ from Kaggle. It can be accessed at: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/mastmustu/income

title: Graphs
text: Here are some more graphs which explore how other factors (work class, age, sex, and race) impacted income!

title: About
text:
I’m Tulika, a highschooler at CJCP (Class of 2027). Take a look at my Github, and feel free to contact me at puniatulika@gmail.com.
My project is about the correlation between education level (as well as other factors) and income. The GitHub repository can be accessed here: https://github.com/puniat/income
This project was created as a part of Kane’s Data Science Bootcamp. More information available at: https://bootcamp.davidkane.info/

title: Correlation Between Education Level and Income
text:
This project aims to analyze the correlation between education levels and income using a Bayesian regression model. It visualizes income data against various education levels to explore the common belief that higher education correlates strongly with higher income.









Education levels may not influence income as significantly as commonly believed. Data for this analysis is sourced from the Kaggle dataset ‘Income Data,’ which covers information such as individual income, education level, age, race, sex, and more. Although individuals with undergraduate and postgraduate degrees may have a higher income in certain cases, your education level does not severely impact your income (this mainly applies to 10th grade and on).
